titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bennett Cerf Papers

Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion July 7, 2009

change.item: XML document instance created by Catherine C. Ricciardi

physdesc.extent: 52 linear ft (ca. 6,300 items in 71 boxes, 45 volumes, & 22 oversized items).

repository.corpname: Columbia UniversityRare Book and Manuscript Library,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, memorabilia, photographs, phonograph and tape recordings, and printed files. Included are Cerf's personal correspondence files, 1929-1945, and the diaries and scrapbooks which he maintained from his school days throughout his active career. The diaries, in date-book format, contain terse notes on Cerf's meetings with authors and friends, on his travels and publishing activities; the scrapbooks contain correspondence and photographs, as well as memorabilia and printed items, and were annotated by Cerf and his wife, Phyllis Fraser Cerf Wagner. Also in the collection are manuscripts and proofs for Cerf's books including "The Laugh's on Me", "Treasury of Atrocious Puns", "The Sound of Laughter", "Stories to Make You Feel Better", and "At Random: the Reminiscences of Bennett Cerf", which was edited by Phyllis Cerf Wagner and Albert Erskine, 1977. The papers also include condolence letters written at the time of Cerf's death, photographs and photo albums,certificates and awards, and miscellaneous printed material, including Random House and Modern Library catalogues. Among the major correspondents are: Truman Capote, Dwight D. Eisenhower, Edna Ferber, Moss Hart, J. Edgar Hoover, Hubert Humphrey, Lyndon B. Johnson, John Lindsay, Joshua Logan, John O'Hara, Jacqueline Onassis, Richard Rodgers, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Gertrude Stein, Adlai Stevenson, Harry Truman, and Robert Penn Warren.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: Boxes 3-75. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 10/09/1998 M-98-10-09 12 letters to & from M.H. Sherwood 2293B Purchase

custodhist.p: Gift of Phyllis Cerf Wagner and the Cerf Foundation, 1975, 1978-1981 (yearly), 1983, & 1984; Gift of Random House, 1988.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Bennett Cerf papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 12 letters to & from M.H. Sherwood Cataloged 10/15/1998 HR

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

otherfindaid.p: Finding aid in repository and online.
